text.div:
Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition EHDSCondition

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
EHDSCondition 0..*EHDSDataSetCondition model

Elements defined in Ancestors:header
header
author[x] 0..*EHDSHealthProfessional, EHDSOrganisation, EHDSDeviceThe author of the condition information.
status 1..1CodeableConceptStatus of the condition/problem (e.g. active, resolved, inactive, etc)
Binding Description: (preferred): HL7 Condition Clinical Status Codes
problem 1..1CodeableConceptCode identifying the condition, problem or diagnosis
Binding Description: (preferred): ICD-10, SNOMED CT, ICD-O, Orphacode if rare disease is diagnosed
onsetDate 0..1dateTimeOnset date of a problem/condition
endDate 0..1dateTimeThe date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission
category 0..*CodeableConceptCategory or categories of the problem (e.g. POA - present on admission, HAC - hospital aquired condition, and other categorisations).
resolutionCircumstances 0..1stringDescribes the reason for which the status of the problem changed from current to inactive (e.g. surgical procedure, medical treatment, etc.).
severity 0..1CodeableConceptA subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.
Binding Description: (preferred): HL7 Condition/Diagnosis Severity; SNOMED CT
bodySite 0..*EHDSBodyStructureThe anatomical location including laterality where this condition manifests itself.
stage 0..*CodeableConceptStage/grade usually assessed formally using a specific staging/grading system. Multiple assessment systems could be used.
Binding Description: (preferred): e.g. TNM, ICD-O-3, Bi-Rads, Li-Rads, …
diagnosisAssertionStatus 0..1CodeableConceptAssertion about the certainty associated with a diagnosis. Diagnostic and/or clinical evidence of condition.
Binding Description: (preferred): HL7 Condition Verification Status
specialistContact 0..*EHDSHealthProfessionalHealth Professional who may be specifically related to the problem, as a preferred contact.
externalResource 0..*uriExternal Resource which may be specifically related to the problem, for example a link between a rare disease problem and the corresponding guidelines.

Documentation for this format

name: EHDSCondition
title: Condition model
description: Model for a clinical condition, problem, diagnosis, or other event, situation, or issue that has risen to a level of concern.

element.short: Condition model
element.definition: Model for a clinical condition, problem, diagnosis, or other event, situation, or issue that has risen to a level of concern.

element.short: Basic metadata for this information
element.definition: Basic metadata for this information

element.short: Patient/subject information
element.definition: Patient/subject information

element.short: Business identifier for the object, unique within its system. Supporting disambiguation between different contexts (systems/countries).
element.definition: Business identifier for the object, unique within its system. Supporting disambiguation between different contexts (systems/countries).

element.short: The author of the condition information.
element.definition: The author of the condition information.

element.short: Date and optionally time of authoring/issuing
element.definition: Date and optionally time of authoring/issuing

element.short: Status of the condition/problem (e.g. active, resolved, inactive, etc)
element.definition: Status of the condition/problem (e.g. active, resolved, inactive, etc)
element.requirements: eHN Guideline HDR (v1.1): A.2.6.1.7; PS (v3.4) A.2.2.2.1

element.short: Source of information (e.g. patient, patient's proxy). Used in case the patient has authored the information or the author has submitted patient-stated information.
element.definition: Source of information (e.g. patient, patient's proxy). Used in case the patient has authored the information or the author has submitted patient-stated information.

element.short: Language in which the resource is written. Language is expressed by the IETF language tag.
element.definition: Language in which the resource is written. Language is expressed by the IETF language tag.

element.short: Code identifying the condition, problem or diagnosis
element.definition: Code identifying the condition, problem or diagnosis

binding.description: ICD-10, SNOMED CT, ICD-O, Orphacode if rare disease is diagnosed

element.short: Onset date of a problem/condition
element.definition: Onset date of a problem/condition

element.short: The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission
element.definition: The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission
element.requirements: eHN Guideline HDR (v1.1): A.2.6.1.4; PS (v3.4) A.2.2.2.3

element.short: Category or categories of the problem (e.g. POA - present on admission, HAC - hospital aquired condition, and other categorisations).
element.definition: Category or categories of the problem (e.g. POA - present on admission, HAC - hospital aquired condition, and other categorisations).

element.short: Describes the reason for which the status of the problem changed from current to inactive (e.g. surgical procedure, medical treatment, etc.).
element.definition: This field includes free text if the resolution circumstances are not already included in other fields such as surgical procedure, medical device, etc., e.g. hepatic cystectomy (this will be the resolution circumstances for the problem "hepatic cyst" and will be included in surgical procedures).
element.requirements: eHN Guideline HDR (v1.1): A.2.6.1.8; PS (v3.4) A.2.2.2.4

element.short: A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.
element.definition: A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.

element.short: The anatomical location including laterality where this condition manifests itself.
element.definition: The anatomical location including laterality where this condition manifests itself.

element.short: Stage/grade usually assessed formally using a specific staging/grading system. Multiple assessment systems could be used.
element.definition: Stage/grade usually assessed formally using a specific staging/grading system. Multiple assessment systems could be used.

element.short: Assertion about the certainty associated with a diagnosis. Diagnostic and/or clinical evidence of condition.
element.definition: Assertion about the certainty associated with a diagnosis. Diagnostic and/or clinical evidence of condition.

element.short: Health Professional who may be specifically related to the problem, as a preferred contact.
element.definition: Health Professional who may be specifically related to the problem, as a preferred contact.

element.short: External Resource which may be specifically related to the problem, for example a link between a rare disease problem and the corresponding guidelines.
element.definition: External Resource which may be specifically related to the problem, for example a link between a rare disease problem and the corresponding guidelines.
